definitions.text: To administer the sacrament of baptism to; to christen. By some denominations of christians, baptism performed by plunging, or immersing the whole body in water, and this done to none but adults. More generally the ceremony performed by sprinkling water on the face of person, whether an infant or an adult, and in the case of an infant, by giving him name, in the name of the Father, Son and Holy Spirit, which called Christening.
